attributes.comment:
Regarding DHS Docket No. USCIS- 2006-0044

As an adoptive mother, I cannot imagine the impact that this enormous increase in fees will have
on the cost of adoption, which is already quite large. While there is an impression that people who
adopt overseas are wealthy and for them money is no object, that is far from the truth. The burden
is already quite large and increasing it may only impact the ability of many people to adopt children.

While I understand the need to cover the costs of immigration, I cannot imagine what it will be like
for the thousands of adoptvie parents who have just begun the process, been saving money and
budgeting according to the current schedule only to find that there is a 60%+ increase to the
immigration fees, including the fingerprinting, etc. This may completely halt some adoptions.

Please re-consider such a huge increase. While I understand that raising the costs may be
necessary, this isn't just about "Illegal Immigrants" and people "stealing Jobs from Hardworking
Americans" as others have written. It is also about the lives of some children in desperate need
and the families who are already calling them their own. Please consider a graduated increase
designed only to cover the increase of actual costs.

Sincerely,

Lorraine Rose

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Lorraine Rose
